office.name: Under Secretary of State for Economic Affairs

div.p: On Jun 30, 1958, Congress re-established the position of Under Secretary for Economic Affairs in the Mutual Security Act (P.L. 85-477; 72 Stat. 274). The following year, the Department of State Organization Act of Jul 30, 1959, authorized the President to appoint either an Under Secretary for Political Affairs or an Under Secretary for Economic Affairs (P.L. 86-117; 73 Stat. 265). Between 1959 and 1972, during periods when there was no Under Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, the ranking officer for foreign economic affairs was again either a Deputy Under Secretary or an Assistant Secretary of State. On Jul 13, 1972, Congress established separate and permanent positions at the Under Secretary of State level for Economic Affairs and for Political Affairs, in the Foreign Relations Authorization Act (P.L. 92-352; 86 Stat. 490).
